newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Spanish couple detained in Brazil over baby girl.
newsitem.headline: Spanish couple detained in Brazil over baby girl.

text.p: A Spanish couple were detained by Brazilian police after they applied for a passport for a Brazilian baby they had unofficially adopted, a police official in the northern city of Belem said on Friday.

Isaac Fernando Maza Gil and Maria Angeles Villa-Garcia arrived in Belem on March 23 and wanted to adopt a Brazilian child officially but they discovered the process took longer than they could stay in Brazil, the official said.
They agreed instead to take a newborn baby girl who was related to a Brazilian woman now living in Spain but who had travelled with the Spanish couple to help them.
The child's real mother entered Villa-Garcia's name on the birth certificate but the couple's plans were discovered when they tried to apply for a passport for the baby.

"The passport office official was suspicious about several things...especially the fact the mother had apparently arrived in Brazil on March 23 and the baby was born on March 31," the police official said.
The couple were detained on Thursday and face a sentence of between two to six years in jail, the official said.
They were expected however to be released shortly upon payment of bail, he added.
The couple were understood to have paid no money for the baby girl who has now been returned to her natural mother.
